name: Collective Benefits
slogan: Collective provides big company benefits for the self-employed
description:
Collective is on a mission to build the safety net for the freelance economy by giving freelancers the benefits, protections and perks of big company employment. 

The way we work is fundamentally changing with freelancers representing a significant and growing market in the UK and abroad. There are currently over 5 million freelancers in the UK, 11 million in the EU and 35 million in the USA.  Whilst freelancing comes with many advantages, it leaves many people underserved with regard to their financial wellness compared to their employed peers.  This protection gap leaves a significant population highly exposed and vulnerable and without the support they need.

We want to fix this by rebuilding benefits from the ground-up and making them fit for the future of work. This includes developing our own unique suite of innovative insurance products and bringing them together with best in class benefits and perks all in one simple to use digital platform.

team.name: benjamin hay
team.bioHtml: Co-Founder at Collective | Formerly of Virgin Group | Recovering Lawyer

team.title: CEO

team.bioHtml: CEO @Collective | Formerly Innovation @ Aviva and Founder & COO of Unbound (acquired in 2016)

team.bioHtml:
CRO @ Collective Benefits -  We're building a safety net for the self-employed.

Start-up Growth Director and Advisor. Ex Founder (Tabl) and Zomato.

team.title: Head of Product
team.name: Dan Symons
team.bioHtml: Product @collective-6 • Co-founded @Folio • Worked at @Songkick, @Hype Experiences, @Naming Matters • Studied at @London School of Economics

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.description:
As SDR at Collective Benefits, you will be the first sales hire to join our team and have the opportunity to drive client sales, build relationships and our presence with leading gig and freelance platforms. 
 
We are looking for an energetic and commercially-minded sales executive, with an aptitude for hitting targets and devising creative ways to exceed them. You’ll have around 3-5 years of sales experience, ideally with a consultative sales approach, subscription-based product experience and a solid track record of winning new business. 
 
Our clients are the top gig and freelance platforms in the UK and you will be responsible for identifying key target partners as well as securing and delivering partnerships.

As we are a rapidly growing company you will gain exposure to all areas of the business, understanding the key success drivers at an early stage company and gaining invaluable experience with significant scope for future development.

An entrepreneurial, growth hacking, and commercial mindset will be key, together with an incredible amount of drive, analytical mindset, integrity and passion for our mission. 

For more information:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1J9xTVp_Gaognq9FVKmQgGSSb8fFBRIDj_-YbredrZDc/edit?usp=sharing

jobs.title: UX/UI Designer
jobs.description:
We're on the hunt for our first full-time designer with a strong portfolio of work across both web and mobile. The role will be primarily focussed on UI/UX as well as some branding work, and will be based out of our Central London office. Note that we are of course remote for now!

Collective is building a community for the self-employed. We provide our members with access to an exclusive range of protections, benefits, and perks normally reserved for big company employees.

As a UX/UI Designer at Collective Benefits, you will be the first full-time design hire to join our team and will have the opportunity to shape the continued development of our digital product and brand identity.
 
We’re looking for a motivated and obsessive designer, with an aptitude for pixel perfect screen output. You have empathy for customer needs, but can also consider technical constraints and business goals. You’ll have at least 3-5 years of design experience, ideally working with a top-tier tech company or digital agency. 

For more information: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1s9ZRWJqdz76Uu7SLhQ3BLQ_sKtlIT_gjAW1SVI2Pq9E/edit?usp=sharing
